list.comment:
Migrate database and configure Docker for PostgreSQL and Redis
- Updated Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml for PostgreSQL and Redis integration - Added environment variables for PostgreSQL configuration - Successfully executed database migrations - Ensured Celery worker runs with Redis as the message broker - Implemented task for sending email notifications when a comment is replied to - Verified email functionality with Celery and Redis integration
This commit finalizes the setup for using PostgreSQL as the database and Redis for message brokering in the Docker environment, and includes functionality for sending email notifications.

task.summary:
Initial commit - Setup project structure and implement comments functionality with CAPTCHA
- Initialize Django project and application structure - Create User and Comment models to support basic comment functionality - Implement form classes (UserForm, CommentForm) for user and comment creation - Add support for nested comments using recursive template inclusion - Integrate django-simple-captcha for spam protection on comment forms - Create views for listing comments, adding comments, and replying to comments - Implement templates for displaying and adding comments (add_comment.html, list_comments.html, replies.html) - Ensure proper URL routing with namespacing for comments and CAPTCHA - Add basic CSS styling for templates to improve visual appearance
This commit sets up the initial structure of the Django project, adds the ability to post comments and replies, and integrates CAPTCHA protection to prevent spam submissions. The project now supports nested comments and basic form validation.

Implement file and image upload functionality
- Add fields for image and file uploads to the Comment model - Add validation for image size (500KB limit), format (JPG, GIF, PNG), and resizing images if they exceed 320x240 pixels - Add validation for text file size (100KB limit) and format (TXT only) - Update CommentForm to handle image and file uploads with validation - Update views to handle file and image uploads - Create and update templates (list_comments.html, replies.html) to display uploaded images and files - Configure MEDIA_URL and MEDIA_ROOT for handling media files - Ensure media files are served correctly in development by updating urlpatterns
This commit adds functionality for users to upload images and text files along with their comments. Images are validated for size and format, and resized if necessary. Text files are validated for size and format. Templates are updated to display these files appropriately.

Implement pagination for comments
- Add pagination to the list_comments view to display 25 comments per page - Update list_comments.html template to use page_obj for paginated comments - Add pagination controls to list_comments.html for navigating between pages - Style pagination controls with CSS for better user experience
This commit adds pagination functionality to the comments section, allowing users to navigate through comments in a paginated manner. Each page displays up to 25 comments, with navigation controls to move between pages.

Add sorting functionality and button for adding comments
- Implemented sorting functionality for comments by User Name, E-mail, and creation date, both ascending and descending. - Updated the list_comments view to handle sorting parameters. - Enhanced the list_comments.html template to include sorting controls and updated styles. - Added a button for adding comments to the main comments page for easier navigation. - Updated styles for the new button and sorting controls to improve the user interface.
This commit enhances the user experience by providing sorting options for comments and a convenient button to add new comments.

Migrate database and configure Docker for PostgreSQL and Redis
- Updated Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml for PostgreSQL and Redis integration - Added environment variables for PostgreSQL configuration - Successfully executed database migrations - Ensured Celery worker runs with Redis as the message broker - Implemented task for sending email notifications when a comment is replied to - Verified email functionality with Celery and Redis integration
This commit finalizes the setup for using PostgreSQL as the database and Redis for message brokering in the Docker environment, and includes functionality for sending email notifications.
